You shall not hate any of your kindred in your heart. Reprove your neighbor openly so that you do not incur sin because of that person. Take no revenge and cherish no grudge against your own people. You shall love your neighbor as yourself.

Leviticus 19:17-18

RT @USNavy In a historic moment just in time for Martin Luther King Jr. Day, @SECNAV announces that the newest #USNavy aircraft carrier will be named USS Doris Miller #CVN81. Miller was the first African American to receive the Navy Cross. 

Full story: https://www.navy.mil/submit/display.asp?story_id=111881 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1218905637784096768/pu/img/sQE01qTWvVlA502w.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1218905637784096768/pu/vid/320x320/NwZI-hG-EzKxG6VB.mp4?tag=10

Today we pay tribute to the life & legacy of Dr. King in Massachusetts & across the country. It is up to all of us to continue his fight for social, racial, & economic justice to make his dream a reality. #MLKDay https://www.baystatebanner.com/2020/01/16/martin-luther-king-jr-s-boston-legacy/

Wow. WATCH this. Stunning.  Wonder why the media changed their mind? https://twitter.com/themrc/status/1219283441553797120 QT @theMRC FLASHBACK: The liberal media hated the idea of calling more witnesses during Bill Clinton's impeachment, saying it was a "distraction" and a "sham." http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOvCtQ7XkAEDXAU.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1219281568247767042/vid/480x270/MAMvd-Ob16HGkAlT.mp4?tag=13

RT @FaithfullyBP “We can’t sit around and use the high school history version of Dr. King.

King’s life did not end because he said ‘I have a dream.’ It ended because he was dangerous to the core injustices of this nation...

If we want to honor him, we have to be dangerous too.” - @AOC #MLKDay http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOvLaZDX0AEPLEK.jpg

Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. understood that you can’t have equality among people if everyone doesn’t have an equal shot at economic freedom and dignity. 

As we reflect on Dr. King’s legacy this #MLKDay, let’s recommit to continuing his fight for economic and racial justice.

RT @janeosanders I love this man https://twitter.com/berniesanders/status/1219337813470208004 QT @BernieSanders Our job is not just to remember the history of Dr. King. It is to absorb his revolutionary spirit and apply it today. And that means we will fight racism in every part of American society. #MLKDay http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1219271453360693253/img/aHwxd_R1cEWYfFNI.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1219271453360693253/vid/320x320/EkS325Mb9cIR5rQG.mp4?tag=13

RT @TeamWarren Today we honor the life of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., and we mark the 25th anniversary of the day of service that celebrates his legacy.

Our team is out across the country giving back to their communities—share with us how you are serving your community today.

Last week, a non-partisan federal report confirmed that Trump broke the law by withholding military aid to Ukraine.

It’s more important now than ever that we hear firsthand from those who helped Trump break the law—including Michael Duffey and Robert Blair.

Powerful. Very much worth watching. Last Sunday, I was blessed to worship with the congregation at West Freeway Church of Christ. I spent time with Jack Wilson and his family. Jack’s heroism saved many, many lives in the face of evil. This is his story. https://twitter.com/bennyjohnson/status/1219051740512866306 QT @bennyjohnson Jack is a hero.

A murderer came to Jack’s church in Texas.

Jack drew his firearm & put a single bullet into the monster's head from 50ft

Jack tells me, “Evil exists in the world - be prepared to defend yourself”

Democrats want to disarm heroes like Jack.

Don’t let them do it http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1219050004368719875/img/7G-Lm70gxqJhqJ-6.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1219050004368719875/vid/360x270/VkmA2LEyvBkE_k2T.mp4?tag=13

A growing number of doctors are sick and tired of the enormous waste and bureaucracy in our cruel and dysfunctional health care system.

Medicare for All will give doctors the freedom to focus on making their patients healthy, not making health insurance executives wealthy. https://twitter.com/rachelcohrs/status/1219382883930071041 QT @rachelcohrs New: The American College of Physicians officially endorsed single-payer healthcare reform today for the first time. https://www.modernhealthcare.com/politics-policy/acp-endorses-single-payer-public-option-plans

RT @loisbeckett What is so striking about the scene at the gun rights rally in Richmond is what you don’t see: almost no cops. Just that little cluster of state police there. No lines of riot cops. No law enforcement in riot gear. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1219286468692193280/pu/img/EaRlKlnRp3NaKYCh.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1219286468692193280/pu/vid/320x568/IIKiPgjlnSaaTZLh.mp4?tag=10

RT @DeseretNews “An individual has not started living until he can rise above the narrow confines of his individualistic concerns to the broader concerns of all humanity.” #MLKDay https://www.deseret.com/opinion/2020/1/20/21070913/martin-luther-king-jr-speeches-lessons-principles-legacy?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=deseretnews&utm_campaign=twitter

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. inspired the masses with his message of hope, justice, and opportunity. On #MLKDay, we honor this champion for civil rights and reaffirm our commitment to protect the equality of all. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOgtfguW4AEJ4bj.jpg
Today we honor the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., and his fight for social, racial, and economic justice. We honor his struggles and triumphs. We honor his courage and his vision.
We need a government that believes in justice, not greed.

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. awakened the conscience of a nation and challenged us to live up to our highest ideals. So though this is a moment of crisis, I marched with a heart full of hope that together we'll one day achieve the racial, social, and economic justice he dreamed of. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOxDsChWkAAE3rb.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOxDsChWsAI4IDj.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOxDsCkWAAAe3wV.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOxDsClXkAEMtbm.jpg

Even for NBC, this is...odd. https://twitter.com/steveguest/status/1219281030126931968 QT @SteveGuest Crowd recites the Pledge of Allegiance.

NBC reporter tweets: "Chants of “we will not comply” from gun rights protesters in Richmond." https://twitter.com/gabegutierrez/status/1219271317242945540

The arc of the moral universe does not bend toward justice with inevitability—we must be the arc benders.
 
Let us honor Dr. King’s legacy by recommitting ourselves to carrying the burden of justice in our communities. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOsDjYuW4AQm_2M.png

Doris “Dorie” Miller was a Texan & a Pearl Harbor hero. Today the @USNavy honored his legacy by naming its new aircraft carrier after Miller, making this the first aircraft carrier ever named after an African American. https://twitter.com/usnavy/status/1219327882406899717 QT @USNavy .@SECNAV hosts family members of World War II hero Doris "Dorie" Miller at @USSArizona Memorial while on tour of @JBPHH. Acting Secretary of the Navy Thomas B. Modly will name a Gerald R. Ford-class aircraft carrier in honor of Miller during a ceremony today. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOvsOvXU0AAEXKv.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOvsPBwWkAQxQE8.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOvsPdmXUAMKltD.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOvsP1PXkAA0YTr.jpg

I plan to engage communities by showing up, listening, and learning. In this historical moment, we especially need to remember the real Martin Luther King, because there are a lot of false portraits that are being pandered in the public square. #MLKDay #MLKDay2020 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOs1H3yX4AAkMgz.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1219125731223134209/vid/480x270/-eqZ_k3ptJwG9QGt.mp4?tag=13

RT @1199mass Home care workers across the country are carrying on #MLK’s legacy by fighting for long term care for all & the essential care older Americans and people with disabilities deserve to live with dignity at home. #RiseUpHomeCare http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOv2jkZU8AArWgo.jpg

"The policy of Sanders' campaign, much like the Poor People's Campaign of Dr. King, or Eugene Debs' campaign 100 years ago before him, it is aligned for all people." –@KillerMike http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOv4yBAXkAELOPQ.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1219320189403246592/vid/320x320/561FpDx1CjGOUeM1.mp4?tag=13

RT @BerniceKing Please join me in celebrating my mother, #CorettaScottKing.

She founded @TheKingCenter, a memorial & nonviolence training center, less than 3 months after my father was assassinated.

And she was diligent in her pursuit of #MLKDay.

She is the architect of the King Legacy.

#MLK http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOurANUXkAAVzd4.jpg

RT @AyannaPressley Black women have been robbed of things for a long time, that’s nothing new

Robbed of our men who were lynched

Robbed of our children who were stolen from us at the auction block

But we will not be robbed of our joy

Joy is a necessary act of resistance http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1219355019872436225/pu/img/rf_we0TU6uxpL5nf.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1219355019872436225/pu/vid/320x568/7hVuuPYchBuu_Re3.mp4?tag=10

One year from today we will swear in a new president.

When we stand together, when we reject the forces of greed, hatred and bigotry, we can be incredibly powerful.

Let's take our movement to the White House and transform this country into the nation we know we can become. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOwaIUzUcAAoK8n.jpg
My statement on the start of the impeachment trial→ https://www.romney.senate.gov/romney-statement-start-impeachment-trial

In 1968, Dr. King said “Now our struggle is for genuine equality, which means economic equality.”

The minimum wage then was worth $10.15. Today, it’s $7.25.

Our fight for human dignity must include making every job pay a living wage of at least $15 an hour. #MLKDay

El sen. Rubio emitió un comunicado con motivo del viaje del @SecPompeo a Bogotá para reunirse con el pres. interino de #Venezuela @jguaido y donde el secretario de estado dará un discurso en el marco de la tercera reunión regional contra terrorismo.

History has its eyes on us. How are we going to operate?

We must ensure the lessons he taught & the story of his life live on for generations to come. #MLKDay http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOu1rT_XsAAPgQV.jpg

Shahab Dehghani is an Iranian student with a valid F1 visa, returning to finish his education. CBP already held him overnight. His deportation must be halted, and we must fight the Trump administration's xenophobic policies. https://www.masslive.com/politics/2020/01/shahab-dehghani-iranian-studying-at-northeastern-university-detained-at-boston-logan-international-airport.html

For-profit detention companies donated generously to Donald Trump, and they've made millions implementing Trump’s cruel immigration policies. It's corruption, pure and simple. I'll fight to permanently ban for-profit prisons and detention centers. https://inthesetimes.com/article/22266/ICE-immigrant-justice-prison-industrial-complex-GEO-Group

I'm heartsick for Mustafa Kassem and his family. Imprisoned for six years with negligent medical care—while Donald Trump praised the dictator who held him prisoner and refused to hold him accountable. We must stand up for human rights. https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/us-citizen-dies-in-egyptian-prison-despite-warnings-over-his-poor-medical-condition/2020/01/14/a750aee0-3656-11ea-a1ff-c48c1d59a4a1_story.html

If we do not allow Trump and his friends to divide us by the color of our skin, where we were born, our sexual orientation or our religion—if we stand together, there is nothing that we cannot accomplish in the fight for racial, economic, social and environmental justice.

To truly honor Dr. King we must fight to carry out his radical and bold vision for racial and economic justice in America and transform our national priorities. The struggle continues to this day, and our work is far from over. #MLKDay http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EOuySqSX4AI_5Ab.jpg

Our job is not just to remember the history of Dr. King. It is to absorb his revolutionary spirit and apply it today. And that means we will fight racism in every part of American society. #MLKDay http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1219271453360693253/img/aHwxd_R1cEWYfFNI.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1219271453360693253/vid/320x320/EkS325Mb9cIR5rQG.mp4?tag=13

Thinking of these words today by Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. - “The time is always right to do what is right.”
